prototypes.prototype: .Open as A5Storage::CallResult (BYREF SubContainerResult as P, Cache as A5Storage::NameCache, ConnectionString as C, Prefix as C [, PassPhrase as C])
.Open as A5Storage::CallResult (BYREF SubContainerResult as P, ConnectionString as C, Prefix as C [, PassPhrase as C])

argument.name: Cache
argument.description: Defines a set of Storage container connection strings.

argument.name: ConnectionString
argument.description: The connection string for the Storage container.

argument.name: PassPhrase
argument.description: A passphrase used to decrypt the connection string. Only required if the connection string is encrypted.

return.name: Result
return.description: Information about whether or not the operation succeed. Result.Success with be .T. if the operation succeeds, otherwise .F.

page.description: Opens a Storage SubContainer based on a connection string and the prefix provided.

section.example: Example: Connect to a Storage Container

dim CallResult as CallResult dim SubContainer as A5Storage::SubContainer = null_value()
CallResult = A5Storage::SubContainer::Open(SubContainer, "Provider='Disk';Container='c:\A5Webroot';", "logs")
if CallResult.Success ' etc end if
Example: Connect to Multiple Storage Containers
section.description: The connection string passed in this example does not have to be a named connection. If you pass a named connection, you must also provide a cache to look it up in.
section.example:
dim CallResult as CallResult dim SubContainer as A5Storage::SubContainer = null_value() dim Storages as C = <<%txt% Storage1 Provider='Disk';Container='C:\A5WebRoot1'; Storage2 Provider='Disk';Container='C:\A5WebRoot2'; %txt% dim Cache as A5Storage::NameCache = new A5Storage::NameCache(Storages)
CallResult = A5Storage::SubContainer::Open(SubContainer, Cache, "::NAME::MyConnectionString", "logs") if CallResult.Success ' etc end if
